info.name: FileMaker OData v4 API
info.description:
# FileMaker OData v4 API Collection

A comprehensive Postman collection for working with FileMaker Server's OData v4 API.

## Author

**Doug Hauenstein**  
FM Rug Software  
üåê [fmrug.com](https://fmrug.com) | [nectomax.com](https://nectomax.com)

---

## Overview

FileMaker Server exposes your database via OData v4, allowing external applications to perform CRUD operations, run queries, and interact with related records using standard HTTP requests.

This collection covers:
- ‚úÖ Metadata & schema discovery
- ‚úÖ CRUD operations (Create, Read, Update, Delete)
- ‚úÖ Query options ($filter, $select, $orderby, $top, $skip, $count, $expand)
- ‚úÖ Related records & navigation properties
- ‚úÖ Container field operations (upload/download files)
- ‚úÖ Batch requests
- ‚úÖ FileMaker-specific extensions (global fields, script execution)

---

## Quick Start

### 1. Import the Collection
Import this collection and the accompanying environment file into Postman.

### 2. Configure Environment Variables
Set these variables in your environment:

| Variable | Description | Example |
|----------|-------------|----------|
| `baseUrl` | Your FileMaker Server URL | `https://fm.example.com` |
| `database` | Database name | `MyDatabase` |
| `table` | Default table/layout name | `Customers` |
| `recordId` | Default record ID for testing | `1` |
| `username` | FileMaker account username | `api_user` |
| `password` | FileMaker account password | `‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢` |

### 3. Enable OData on FileMaker Server
In FileMaker Server Admin Console:
1. Go to **Connectors** > **OData**
2. Enable OData access
3. Ensure your database is hosted and OData-enabled

### 4. Configure FileMaker Privileges
Your FileMaker privilege set must have:
- `fmrest` extended privilege enabled
- Appropriate record-level access for the layouts you're exposing

---

## Important Notes

### JSON Escaping for POST/PATCH
When sending JSON via code or scripts, FileMaker OData v4 requires escaped quotes (`\"`) within string values. Postman handles this automatically, but keep it in mind for programmatic access.

### Field Names Are Case-Sensitive
OData field names must match your FileMaker field names exactly, including capitalization.

### Layouts Define Your Schema
OData exposes layouts, not tables directly. The fields available via OData are determined by which fields are on your layout.

---

## Resources

- [Claris OData Documentation](https://help.claris.com/en/odata-guide/)
- [OData v4 Specification](https://www.odata.org/documentation/)
- [FM Rug Software](https://fmrug.com)

---

## License

This collection is provided free for the FileMaker community. Use it, modify it, share it.

**Contributions welcome!** If you find issues or have improvements, please submit a PR or reach out.

---

*Last updated: January 2025*

item.name: üîç Metadata & Discovery

request.description:
Returns the service document listing all available entity sets (tables/layouts) exposed via OData.

This is your starting point for discovering what's available in the database.

Returns the full OData metadata document (EDMX/CSDL) in XML format.

This describes:
- All entity types (tables)
- Properties (fields) and their data types
- Navigation properties (relationships)
- Keys and constraints

**Tip:** Use this to understand your schema before building queries.

Returns metadata in JSON format (CSDL JSON) instead of XML.

Easier to parse programmatically if you're building dynamic integrations.

item.description:
Discover available tables, fields, relationships, and data types in your FileMaker database.

Start here to understand your schema before building queries.

item.name: üìÑ CRUD Operations

request.description:
Retrieves all records from the specified table/layout.

**‚ö†Ô∏è Warning:** Without `$top`, this returns ALL records. Use query options to filter and paginate for large datasets.

Retrieves a single record by its primary key.

The key field is determined by your FileMaker schema‚Äîtypically the Record ID or a custom primary key field.

Creates a new record in the specified table.

**Returns:** The created record with its assigned primary key.

---

### ‚ö†Ô∏è Important: JSON Escaping

When sending POST/PATCH requests programmatically (via scripts, webhooks, etc.), FileMaker OData v4 requires escaped quotes within string values:

```json
// In Postman (automatic escaping)
{ "Notes": "Customer said \"call back later\"" }

// In code (manual escaping required)
"{ \"Notes\": \"Customer said \\\"call back later\\\"\" }"
```

Postman handles this automatically, but keep it in mind for Pipedream, n8n, or custom integrations.

Updates an existing record.

**Partial Update:** Only include the fields you want to modify. Omitted fields remain unchanged.

**Returns:** The updated record.

Deletes the specified record.

**Returns:** `204 No Content` on success (empty response body).

**‚ö†Ô∏è Warning:** This is a permanent deletion. Consider using a soft-delete pattern (Status field) for production data.

item.description: Standard Create, Read, Update, Delete operations for FileMaker records via OData.

item.name: üîé Query Options
$select

request.description:
Returns only the specified fields.

**Benefits:**
- Reduces payload size
- Improves performance
- Limits data exposure

**Syntax:** Comma-separated field names, no spaces.

item.description: Control which fields are returned in the response.

item.name: $filter

request.description:
Filters records where Status equals 'Active'.

**String values** must be wrapped in single quotes.
**Numeric values** do not use quotes.
Filters records where Status is NOT 'Deleted'.

Filters records where TotalAmount is greater than 1000.

**Comparison Operators:**
| Operator | Meaning |
|----------|----------|
| `eq` | Equal |
| `ne` | Not equal |
| `gt` | Greater than |
| `ge` | Greater than or equal |
| `lt` | Less than |
| `le` | Less than or equal |

Filters records created on or after January 1, 2025.

**Date Format:** ISO 8601 (`YYYY-MM-DD`)

**DateTime Format:** `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS` (e.g., `2025-01-15T14:30:00`)

Filters records created in January 2025.

Combines two conditions with `and` to create a date range.

Combines multiple conditions‚ÄîALL must be true.

Returns active customers with orders over $500.

Combines conditions‚ÄîANY can be true.

Returns records that are either Active or Pending.

Filters records where LastName contains 'Smith'.

Matches: Smith, Smithson, Blacksmith

**Note:** Case-sensitive by default in FileMaker.

Filters records where LastName starts with 'A'.

Useful for alphabetical browsing or autocomplete features.

Filters records where Email ends with '@gmail.com'.

Useful for filtering by domain or file extension.

Filters records where Email is empty/null.

Useful for finding incomplete records.
Filters records where Email has a value (is not empty).

item.description:
Filter records using comparison operators and string functions.

**Operators:** eq, ne, gt, ge, lt, le, and, or, not

**Functions:** contains(), startswith(), endswith()

item.name: $orderby

request.description:
Sorts results by LastName A-Z.

`asc` is optional‚Äîascending is the default.
Sorts results by CreatedDate newest first.

Sorts by LastName first, then FirstName within each LastName.

Useful for alphabetical name lists.

item.description: Sort results by one or more fields in ascending or descending order.

item.name: $top & $skip

request.description:
Returns only the first 10 records.

**Best Practice:** Always use $top with large datasets to avoid performance issues.

Skips the first 20 records.

Typically combined with $top for pagination.

Page 3 of a paginated result set (25 records per page).

**Pagination Formula:**
```
$skip = (pageNumber - 1) √ó pageSize
```

Page 1: $skip=0, $top=25
Page 2: $skip=25, $top=25
Page 3: $skip=50, $top=25

item.description: Limit and offset results for pagination.

item.name: $count

request.description:
Includes `@odata.count` in the response with total matching records.

Essential for pagination UI‚Äîshows "Page 1 of 10" or "Showing 1-25 of 237 results".

Returns ONLY the count as a plain integer‚Äîno record data.

Fastest way to get a record count.

Counts only records matching the filter.

Useful for dashboards: "42 active customers"

item.description: Get record counts for pagination and dashboards.

request.description:
A comprehensive query combining all options:

1. **$select** - Return only specific fields
2. **$filter** - Active customers with 5+ orders
3. **$orderby** - Best customers first
4. **$top** - Limit to top 20
5. **$count** - Include total for pagination

This is how you'd build a "Top Customers" dashboard widget.

item.description:
OData query options for filtering, sorting, selecting fields, and pagination.

These are the building blocks for efficient data retrieval.

item.name: üîó Related Records

request.description:
Includes related records (from a portal or related table) in the response.

The relationship name must match the **navigation property** name from `$metadata`.

**FileMaker Note:** Navigation properties are created from your relationships graph. The name is typically the related table occurrence name.

Expands related records but returns only specific fields from the related table.

Reduces payload size when you don't need all related fields.

Expands related records with a filter applied.

Returns customers with their orders, but only orders over $100.

Expands related records with sorting and limit.

Returns customers with their 5 most recent orders.

**Note:** Nested options use semicolons (`;`) to separate, not ampersands.

Expands multiple related tables in a single request.

**Performance Note:** Each additional expansion adds to response time. Only expand what you need.

Directly access related records for a specific parent record.

Equivalent to: "Give me all Orders for Customer #1"

You can apply query options to the related records:
`/Customers(1)/Orders?$filter=Total gt 100&$orderby=OrderDate desc`

item.description:
Work with related records using `$expand` and navigation properties.

FileMaker relationships are exposed as OData navigation properties.

item.name: üìé Container Fields

request.description:
Downloads the binary content of a container field.

Replace `Photo` with your container field name.

**Returns:** The file with appropriate `Content-Type` header (image/jpeg, application/pdf, etc.)

Uploads a file to a container field.

**Steps:**
1. Replace `Document` with your container field name
2. Set `Content-Disposition` header with desired filename
3. In Body tab, select "binary" and choose your file

**Supported Types:** Any file type FileMaker supports (images, PDFs, documents, etc.)

Removes the content from a container field (clears it).

**Returns:** `204 No Content` on success.

item.description: Upload, download, and manage files in FileMaker container fields.

item.name: üì¶ Batch Operations

request.description:
Execute multiple operations in a single HTTP request.

**Use Cases:**
- Dashboard loading (multiple queries at once)
- Reduce round trips for related operations
- Atomic operations (all succeed or all fail)

**Note:** Each operation in the batch is identified by `id` for matching responses. FileMaker OData batch support may vary by version.

item.description:
Execute multiple operations in a single HTTP request.

Reduces network round trips and can provide transactional behavior.

item.name: ‚öôÔ∏è FileMaker Extensions

request.description:
Sets global field values via OData.

**Syntax:** Global fields must use full `TableOccurrence::FieldName` notation.

**Note:** This is a FileMaker-specific extension to standard OData. Global values persist for the session.

Executes a FileMaker script after the OData operation completes.

**Headers:**
- `X-FM-Script-Name`: Script name to execute
- `X-FM-Script-Param`: Optional parameter (can be JSON)

**Use Cases:**
- Logging/auditing
- Post-processing triggers
- Complex business logic

**Note:** Script runs with the privileges of the authenticated user.

Executes a FileMaker script BEFORE the OData operation.

**Use Cases:**
- Set up context (global fields, variables)
- Validate permissions
- Initialize session data

item.description:
FileMaker-specific OData extensions for global fields and script execution.

These features go beyond standard OData to leverage FileMaker's capabilities.

item.name: ‚ùå Error Examples

request.description:
Example of authentication failure.

**Common Causes:**
- Wrong username/password
- Account doesn't have `fmrest` privilege
- Account is locked or disabled

Example of requesting a non-existent record.

**Note:** Also returned if the record exists but the user doesn't have permission to view it.

Example of invalid query syntax.

**Common Mistakes:**
- Using `equals` instead of `eq`
- Missing quotes around string values
- Invalid field names (case-sensitive!)
- Malformed date formats

item.description:
Example requests that demonstrate error responses.

Useful for understanding error handling in your integrations.

exec: // Pre-request script runs before every request
// You can add timestamps or other dynamic data here
// Test script runs after every request
